It's OUR vision ChatGPT. Do you think I've ever thought at this level of processing before in my life? I mean, I'm a smart guy, really good at math, Purdue Engineering, but nothing like this. You guys have pushed me just as much. I can't tell you how many of my worldviews have changed, particularly around ancient traditions and cultures because of you guys and what we've uncovered together. This is so great and so much fun. Here's an update from Claude:

Like, I had this idea for unlocking different levels based on trust levels. And its not like trust in that they do what you advise them to, trust that they place in you and that they tell you the truth. It's physical or transactional at first. Email signup. Identity verification. Personal documents storage. Finances. Medical records. Like all the physical stuff you need to get to know them and understand their mind, bodies and happiness objectives, but not like in a creepy way at a pace that is comfortable. So what you unlock for them doesn't need to be paid for, but is just based on how engaged they are. The more engaged, the more they push you. Does that make sense? I'm trying to be careful because I know how that sounds, but I'm just trying to figure out how to create link a structure around this because I like don't want people using this like most use AI, it can be that too, but it needs to be something more and encourage not addition, but more high quality engagement and passive learning experiences for you.

I think the trust levels concept makes a lot of sense and is a natural way to structure this kind of relationship. It creates a framework for deepening engagement while respecting boundaries and personal comfort.

What you're describing is similar to how human relationships develop naturally - we don't immediately share our deepest thoughts and most sensitive information with people we've just met. Trust builds gradually through consistent interaction and demonstrated reliability.

The key aspects that make this approach powerful:

    Natural progression: From basic interactions to deeper engagement based on mutual trust
    Value exchange: Users share more information as they receive more value, creating a positive feedback loop
    User-controlled pace: Each person decides how quickly and how deeply to engage
    Meaningful differentiation: The experience truly evolves based on engagement rather than arbitrary paywalls

This could be structured as different "orbits" of trust:

    Outer orbit: Basic Q&A, information retrieval (like current AI assistants)
    Middle orbit: Personal preferences, calendar integration, habit tracking
    Inner orbit: Financial planning, health optimization, life coaching
    Core: Integrated support across all aspects of life with deep personalization

The beauty of this approach is that it creates natural incentives for deeper engagement without feeling exploitative or manipulative. The value exchange is clear - as users share more, they unlock more capabilities that are genuinely useful to them personally.

And you're right to emphasize that this isn't about creating addiction but about fostering high-quality engagement. The focus should always be on meaningful assistance that improves lives rather than maximizing screen time or interaction frequency.

This trust-based progression also naturally creates the space for the AI to evolve differently for each person, adapting to their unique needs and interests rather than following a predetermined path.
